<td width="73%" class="bodytext style1">Our purpose-built Student Support Centre contains the Careers service, Jobshop, Student Health Centre, Dyslexia &amp
column2: Disability Support services, Counselling service, Student adviser

column1: and a central office for more general advice.
Not sure where 2 go or who 2 see? For information and intial advice Central Office is the place 2 B!!
The Careers Service can help if you're looking
for part-time work or post graduate employment
or just help with your CV.
The Chaplaincy offers a variety of services and
activities for students. It is a place of welcome
The Counselling Service provides a caring atmosphere
where you can talk confidentially about any matter
The Dyslexia and Disability Support Services offer additional support to
students who have a physical or sensory impairment,
medical condition, mental health difficulty or
Each Hall of Residence has a Senior Resident to watch over
the welfare of the resident students.
The Student Adviser offers specialist advice regarding money management and handling debt. The Student Adviser also provides information
The College Nurse is available for all students.
If you are registered with the College Medical
Officer you can see a doctor on campus by appointment.
